definition: characteristic of only one person, group, or thing : distinctive
examples: … a drowsy fervour of manner and tone which was quite peculiar to her.

definition: different from the usual or normal:

examples: It seems peculiar that she would leave town without telling anybody.
The play had a zany plot and very peculiar characters.

definition: something exempt from ordinary jurisdiction, a church or parish exempt from the jurisdiction of the ordinary in whose territory it lies
